com.github.breadmoirai.breadbot.framework.event

Class CommandEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dv8tion.jda.core.events.Event
      • com.github.breadmoirai.breadbot.framework.event.CommandEvent
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MessageReceivedCommandEvent

    public abstract class CommandEvent
extends net.dv8tion.jda.core.events.Event
    This holds the context of a command including arguments.

      • getMentionedMembers

        public abstract java.util.List<net.dv8tion.jda.core.entities.Member> getMentionedMembers()
        This will retrieve ass the users mentioned in a message as members. If a user mentioned is not part of the guild, it will not be included.

      • getArgs

        @Deprecated
public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getArgs()
        Deprecated. 
        I think getArguments(int) is more useful than this. idk.

        Parses getContent() as a list of arguments that are space delimited. Code block formatting is stripped and no formatted content is passed such as Mentions. Phrases contained within quotation marks are not separated. Formatted input and mentions are ignored. If message content contains an uneven number of ", the result is not predictable.

        For example, if getContent() returns 

         hello, 1 23 <@12341482523> "say no more" @everyone

        Then this method will return a list with elements 

         ["hello,", "1", "23", "say no more"]
        Returns:
        An immutable list of args.

      • getArgumentCount

        public int getArgumentCount()
        Returns:
        the number of arguments provided.

      • getArgumentAt

        public CommandArgument getArgumentAt(int index)
        retrieves a CommandArgument from the CommandArgumentList returned by getArguments()
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the argument starting at 0. This does not include the key.
        Returns:
        the non-null CommandArgument
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is less than 0 or greater than getArgumentCount()

      • getArguments

        public CommandArgumentList getArguments()
        Calls getArguments(int) with the default limit.
        Returns:
        a CommandArgumentList
        See Also:
        getArguments(int), setDefaultArgumentLimit(int)

      • getArguments

        public CommandArgumentList getArguments(int limit)

        Parses getContent() as a list of arguments that are space delimited. Arguments enclosed in quotes will be returned as a single argument. If message content contains an uneven number of ", the result is not predictable.

        Parameters:
        limit - the limit to set for a maximum number of arguments. For more information on how this is used, see Pattern.split(java.lang.CharSequence, int)
        Returns:
        an implementation of List<EventArgument>

      • createNewArgumentList

        @NotNull
public CommandArgumentList createNewArgumentList(java.lang.String regex,
                                                           int limit)
        Creates a new list of arguments using the provided regex to split the message contents.
        Parameters:
        regex - the regex to split on
        limit - the split limit
        Returns:
        a new CommandArgumentList.
        See Also:
        Pattern.split(java.lang.CharSequence, int)

      • createNewArgumentList

        @NotNull
public CommandArgumentList createNewArgumentList(int limit)
        Creates a new list of arguments using the default regex to split the message contents. recommended to use getArguments(int) instead.
        Parameters:
        limit - the split limit
        Returns:
        a new CommandArgumentList.
        See Also:
        Pattern.split(java.lang.CharSequence, int), DiscordPatterns.ARGUMENT_SPLITTER

      • createNewArgumentList

        @NotNull
public CommandArgumentList createNewArgumentList(java.util.regex.Pattern splitter,
                                                           int limit)
        Creates a new list of arguments using the provided regex to split the message contents.
        Parameters:
        splitter - the pattern to split on
        limit - the split limit
        Returns:
        a new CommandArgumentList.
        See Also:
        Pattern.split(java.lang.CharSequence, int)

      • getEmotes

        public java.util.List<net.dv8tion.jda.core.entities.Emote> getEmotes()
        Parses getContent() to find any custom emotes. If the bot is not in the guild with an emote used, An UnknownEmote will be added to the list instead. Only methods Emote#getName(), Emote#getId(), Emote#getCreationTime(), and Emote#getImageUrl() are supported. You can check for these with Emote#isFake()
        Returns:
        A mutable list of args. Every time this method is called getContent() is parsed again and a new list is returned.

      • hasContent

        public boolean hasContent()
        Checks for whether getContent() will return an empty or null String
        Returns:
        true if getContent() is not empty. False otherwise.

      • checkPermission

        public boolean checkPermission(net.dv8tion.jda.core.Permission... permission)
        Checks to see if the bot has the permissions required.
        Parameters:
        permission - any permissions required.
        Returns:
        true if the bot has the permissions required. false otherwise.

      • requirePermission

        public boolean requirePermission(net.dv8tion.jda.core.Permission... permission)
        Checks to see if the bot has the permissions required. If the permissions required are not found, the user is notified with a MissingPermissionResponse.
        Parameters:
        permission - any permissions required.
        Returns:
        true if the bot has the permissions required. false otherwise.
